data.title: Indian Communist Arrested
data.meta_description: Communist leader E M S Namboodiripad arrested under defense-of-India rules
data.text:

Indian Communist Arrested

Sept. 2, 1964

See the article in its original context from

September 2, 1964 , Page 5Buy Reprints

TimesMachine is an exclusive benefit for home delivery and digital subscribers.

About the Archive

This is a digitized version of an article from The Times’s print archive, before the start of online publication in 1996. To preserve these articles as they originally appeared, The Times does not alter, edit or update them.

Occasionally the digitization process introduces transcription errors or other problems; we are continuing to work to improve these archived versions.

NEW DELHI, Sept. 1— E. M. S. Namboodiripad, a leading Communist, was ar rested today in Trivandrum, capital of Kerala state, under defense-of-India rules, the In dian radio said today. The rules, enforced after the 1962 Chinese Communist invasion of India, permit preventive arests.
